relation: Contains the web context root for the web application.
Maps roles to users or groups in the currently active realm.
Specifies a principal name for a servlet, which is used for the run-as role defined in web.xml.
Specifies a URL pattern for idempotent requests.
Specifies session manager, session cookie, and other session-related information.
Maps the absolute JNDI name to the ejb-ref in the corresponding Java EE XML file.
Maps the absolute JNDI name to the resource-ref in the corresponding Java EE XML file.
Maps the absolute JNDI name to the resource-env-ref in the corresponding Java EE XML file.
Specifies runtime settings for a web service reference.
Specifies the name of a physical message destination.
Configures caching for web application components.
Deprecated. Use the parameter-encoding subelement of sun-web-app instead.
Determines the default request character encoding and how the web container decodes parameters from forms according to a hidden field value.
Specifies a property, which has a name and a value.
Specifies the name of a logical message destination.
Specifies a name and optional publish location for a web service.
pageTitle: Appendix A Deployment Descriptor Files (Sun Java System Application Server 9.1 Application Deployment Guide)
textBeforeTable: Table A–1 Sun Java System Application Server Descriptors The following table lists the Application Server deployment descriptors and their DTD files. For general information about DTD files and XML, see the XML specification at http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml. To check the correctness of these deployment descriptors prior to deployment, see The verifier Utility. Do not edit the DTD files; their contents change only with new versions of the Application Server. Note – Each deployment descriptor (or XML) file has a corresponding DTD file, which defines the elements, data, and attributes that the deployment descriptor file can contain. For example, the sun-application_5_0-0.dtd file defines the structure of the sun-application.xml file. The DTD files for the Application Server deployment descriptors are located in the as-install/lib/dtds directory. Settings in the Application Server deployment descriptors override corresponding settings in the Java EE deployment descriptors and in the Application Server's domain.xml file unless otherwise stated. For more information about the domain.xml file, see the Sun Java System Application Server 9.1 Administration Reference. Note – Sun Java System Application Server uses optional deployment descriptors in addition to the Java EE standard descriptors for configuring features specific to the Application Server. Sun Java System Application Server Descriptors Alphabetical Listing of All Elements The sun-acc.xml File The sun-application-client.xml file
